column4: i've never had any problem with udf disks (video dvd's) even formatted a usb stick with udf and it just works (tm)
how do you do it ?? how did you read your discs ??
i just plug or insert them; no other thing is needed
if you want to manually mount it you would do something like « sudo mount -t udf /dev/scd0 /mount/point/ »
i've tried that... using auto option, using udf option, it doesn't work...
what does the kernel says. i.e what what you get from « dmesg | tail » after trying ?
happens with all dvd you tried ? keep in mind that most data dvd are iso9660 not udf
all other dvd's have worked so far... but this is my first UDF dvd
so, can you throw some more light on this ??
dunno if it only one that fails could be just corrupted
no, it's the only UDF i've used. how do i check for corruption ?
You meant 'build-essential' I suppose. I have that installed. But gnumake/gmake ?
gnumke gmake is == make in linux machines. it is called gnumake gmake in bsd (macosx included ) machines becouse they have their own make
Oops !! Thanks a million ! I was wondering why 'sudo apt-get install gnumake' wasn't working....
